articles.headline: Bribe Cases, a Jared Kushner Partner and Potential Conflicts
articles.snippet: President Trump’s son-in-law, a top adviser, had help building a real estate empire from a member of one of Israel’s wealthiest families.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s son-in-law, a top adviser, had help building a real estate empire from a member of one of Israel’s wealthiest families.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was the summer of 2012, and Jared Kushner was headed downtown.

articles.headline: F.C.C. Chairman Pushes Sweeping Changes to Net Neutrality Rules
articles.snippet: The chairman, Ajit Pai, said high-speed internet service should no longer be treated like a public utility with strict rules but should largely be left to police itself.
articles.abstract: The chairman, Ajit Pai, said high-speed internet service should no longer be treated like a public utility with strict rules but should largely be left to police itself.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The chairman of the Federal Communications Commission on Wednesday outlined a sweeping plan to loosen the government’s oversight of high-speed internet providers, a rebuke of a landmark policy approved two years ago to ensure that all online content is treated the same by the companies that deliver broadband service to Americans.

articles.headline: Hard-Line Republican Caucus Backs Revised Bill to Repeal Obamacare
articles.snippet: The support of the House Freedom Caucus breathed new life into efforts to replace the Affordable Care Act, but it was not clear whether it was enough.
articles.abstract: The support of the House Freedom Caucus breathed new life into efforts to replace the Affordable Care Act, but it was not clear whether it was enough.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House Freedom Caucus, a group of hard-line conservatives who were instrumental in blocking President Trump’s plan to repeal the Affordable Care Act last month, gave its approval Wednesday to a new, more conservative version, breathing new life into Republican efforts to replace President Barack Obama’s health law.
articles.byline: By Jennifer Steinhauer and Robert Pear

articles.headline: How Hulu and ‘The Handmaid’s Tale’ Revived 2 Careers
articles.snippet: Daniel Wilson and Fran Sears hadn’t worked together in years. But they still owned partial rights to a certain 1990 movie based on Margaret Atwood‘s book.
articles.abstract: Daniel Wilson and Fran Sears hadn’t worked together in years. But they still owned partial rights to a certain 1990 movie based on Margaret Atwood‘s book.
articles.lead_paragraph: On Wednesday, one of the most anticipated television shows of the year, “The Handmaid’s Tale,” had its premiere on the streaming service Hulu. Reviews for the series have been rapturous, and it could provide Hulu with an elusive signature hit.

articles.headline: In Ann Coulter’s Speech Battle, Signs That Conservatives Are Emboldened
articles.snippet: Conservatives like Ms. Coulter are eagerly throwing themselves into volatile situations on college campuses, inspired by a backlash against political correctness.
articles.abstract: Conservatives like Ms. Coulter are eagerly throwing themselves into volatile situations on college campuses, inspired by a backlash against political correctness.
articles.lead_paragraph: Without uttering a word to students at the University of California, Berkeley, Ann Coulter on Wednesday made herself the latest cause célèbre in the rapidly escalating effort by conservatives to fight liberals on what was once the left’s moral high ground over free speech on campus.

articles.headline: The Drumbeats Don’t Add Up to Imminent War With North Korea
articles.snippet: President Trump views North Korea as his chief foreign policy issue, but he says he is pursuing a strategy that relies primarily on help from China.
articles.abstract: President Trump views North Korea as his chief foreign policy issue, but he says he is pursuing a strategy that relies primarily on help from China.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump summoned all 100 members of the Senate for a briefing by his war cabinet on the mounting tensions with North Korea. An American submarine loaded with Tomahawk missiles surfaced in a port in South Korea. Gas stations in the North shut down amid rumors that the government was stockpiling fuel.

articles.headline: Trump’s Tax Plan Is a Reckoning for Republican Deficit Hawks
articles.snippet: The White House insists that economic growth will offset its proposed tax cuts, but many economists disagree, creating a moment of truth for conservatives.
articles.abstract: The White House insists that economic growth will offset its proposed tax cuts, but many economists disagree, creating a moment of truth for conservatives.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As President Trump’s top economic advisers faced a barrage of questions on Wednesday about the tax plan they had just unfurled, there was one that they struggled most to answer: how to keep the “massive tax cuts” they proposed from ballooning the federal deficit.

articles.headline: United Takes Added Steps to Win Back Customers and Avoid More Ugly Events
articles.snippet: United Airlines, still trying to regain its footing after a video showed a traveler being violently dragged off a plane, on Thursday outlined new measures meant to prevent such episodes in the future.
articles.abstract: United Airlines, still trying to regain its footing after a video showed a traveler being violently dragged off a plane, on Thursday outlined new measures meant to prevent such episodes in the future.
articles.lead_paragraph: United Airlines, still trying to regain its footing more than two weeks after a video showed a police officer violently dragging a passenger off a plane, on Thursday provided its fullest account yet of the episode and announced a series of steps meant to keep such an event from happening again.

articles.headline: Health Law Repeal Will Miss Trump’s 100-Day Target Date
articles.snippet: House Republican leaders failed Thursday to round up enough votes for their bill to repeal the Affordable Care Act.
articles.abstract: House Republican leaders failed Thursday to round up enough votes for their bill to repeal the Affordable Care Act.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — An 11th-hour White House push to give President Trump a major legislative victory in his first 100 days in office broke down late Thursday as House Republican leaders failed to round up enough votes for their bill to repeal the Affordable Care Act.
articles.byline: By Thomas Kaplan and Robert Pear

articles.headline: Pentagon Inquiry Seeks to Learn if Flynn Hid Foreign Payment
articles.snippet: A disclosure by lawmakers also reveals that the former national security adviser is under investigation by the Defense Department.
articles.abstract: A disclosure by lawmakers also reveals that the former national security adviser is under investigation by the Defense Department.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Michael T. Flynn, the former national security adviser, was explicitly told in 2014 to seek approval for any payments he accepted from a foreign government, documents released on Thursday show.
articles.byline: By Emmarie Huetteman and Matthew Rosenberg

articles.headline: A Hardware Renaissance Grows in Brooklyn — and Elsewhere
articles.snippet: Technology, investors and entrepreneurs are behind a groundswell of innovation in hardware. A Brooklyn center dedicated to commercializing hardware start-ups shows the trend.
articles.abstract: Technology, investors and entrepreneurs are behind a groundswell of innovation in hardware. A Brooklyn center dedicated to commercializing hardware start-ups shows the trend.
articles.lead_paragraph: StrongArm Technologies, a start-up company in Brooklyn, makes “ergo-skeletons” that look a bit like futuristic versions of the back support belts that warehouse workers often wear.

articles.headline: Economists Fear Trump’s Tax Plan Only Heightens a ‘Mountain of Debt’
articles.snippet: A president who campaigned as a fiscal scold offers a tax overhaul that many experts say would mean trillions in lost revenue, and new borrowing, in the next decade.
articles.abstract: A president who campaigned as a fiscal scold offers a tax overhaul that many experts say would mean trillions in lost revenue, and new borrowing, in the next decade.
articles.lead_paragraph: During his campaign, Donald J. Trump embraced the cause of fiscal responsibility and accused President Barack Obama of shackling the country with a “mountain of debt.”
